title: Durban to host Soweto derby TKO quarter-final
text:
Cape Town - The Premier Soccer League (PSL) has announced dates, venues and kick-off times for next weekend's Telkom Knockout quarter-final fixtures.

The quarter-final fixtures will be played on the weekend of 01-03 November 2019.

Tickets will be sold at TicketPro outlets, Spar and selected Sasol garages countrywide and will be available on Friday, 25 October from 12:00.

On Friday evening, 1 November Maritzburg United will be at home against Highlands Park at Harry Gwala Stadium in the first quarter-final fixture.

On Saturday, two Soweto giants will descend to KwaZulu-Natal to play against each other when Kaizer Chiefs face Orlando Pirates at Moses Mabhida Stadium.

Meanwhile, the 2014 Telkom Knockout champions SuperSport United and Lamontville Golden Arrows will travel to Nelspruit to contest for a spot in the semi-finals at Mbombela Stadium on Saturday evening.

The last fixture of the weekend will be played on Sunday between Chippa United and 2015 Telkom Knockout champions Mamelodi Sundowns at Nelson Mandela Bay Stadium.

FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 1

Maritzburg United v Highlands Park, Harry Gwala Stadium – 20:00

SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 2

Kaizer Chiefs v Orlando Pirates, Moses Mabhida Stadium – 15:00

SuperSport United v Golden Arrows, Mbombela Stadium – 20:15

SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 3

Chippa United v Mamelodi Sundowns, Nelson Mandela Bay Stadium – 15:00
description: The Premier Soccer League has announced dates, venues and kick-off times for next weekend’s Telkom Knockout quarter-final fixtures.
